high: i kinda messes up my /etc/environment

when i choice xterm session
i get a broken bash
now how do i mount my hda1 on ubuntu live rescue dvd with write permission ?
mount -t ext3 /dev/hda1 /some/mount/point
assuming hda1 has an ext3 file system on it.
the mount point can be any empty directory
ok, I guess ... :)
some error on mount ... unable to read superblock
that sounds like it isn't the correct file system type.  you are using -t ext3?  are you sure it is ext3?
it's a loopback
it's not unsupported, that's irrelevant
don't go off on a tangent.  Did you answer my question about ext3?
a loopback mount is used with a file, not a partition
wait.  it is either hda1, or a loopback.  not both.
so it isn't hda1?  why did you say it is hda1?
if it is a loopback, it isn't an hd at all
you have to figure out whether you have a disk or not
